rev.comment: Kal, I'm glad that you found a link verifying the other nickname of Peru, but it is not the main one used. Another nickname is "Los Incas," but it is not as used either. See talk page.
/* 1930s Golden generation */ Lowercased letters as suggested by DeLarge.
/* Creation of national team */ Lowercased letters as suggested by DeLarge.
Changed all notes to "Futbolperuano.com" to "Peru.com" as Peru.com is the main website of the information, and set things constant as suggested by user DeLarge.
/* Other tournaments and records */ Changed tripod source per WP: No original research, and as suggested by DeLarge.
/* 1970s Golden generation */ took out geocities source per WP:No Original Research, and as suggested by DeLarge.
/* 1930s Golden generation */ Combined references as suggested by DeLarge. This should be the last of the major reference problems.
/* Creation of national team */ Took out dead link of Atletico Chalaco, removed bad link of Bolognesi, and combined the links of the sentence as suggested by DeLarge.
/* Creation of national team */ Changed link #19 (Which is now #18, due to the deletion of Atletico Chalaco's dead link).
/* Introduction of football */ Found link for Cienciano's page that should not directly open print window.
/* Introduction of football */ Took out source of Atletico Chalaco due to dead link, and as suggested by DeLarge.
reference top scorer and nicknames both are correct . Rojiblanca http://www.peru.com/futbol/seleccion/ (page title) or http://www.larepublica.com.pe/content/view/170319/472/
Replaced 3 "however" with 3 "nevertheless" in order to somewhat even out the usage of the word in the article, as suggested by DeLarge.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/76.68.18.179|76.68.18.179]] to last revision by Odie5533 ([[WP:HG|HG]])
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/76.68.18.179|76.68.18.179]] to last revision by MarshalN20 ([[WP:HG|HG]])
/* From glory to decline */ Deleted names of cities, per suggestion by DeLarge.
/* Present */ Expanded information on the suspension, included source from El Comercio and used the source of Peru.com (already cited) to expand the final sentence on the topic.
/* From glory to decline */ Done with half of the half (if that makes any sense, lol).
Edited half-way through the suggestions given by DeLarge. Stopped at 1980s.
copyedit to fix a few commas and other wee things
/* Notable players */ Replaced individual references on Valeriano Lopez and Teodoro Fernandez from Peru.com to a single reference from Eltiempolatino.com .
/* Players */ This really has no references or citations. I don't even understand what it's supposed to mean. lol.
/* FIFA World Cup record */ Following example of Scotland's article.
/* Other tournaments and records */ Removed Olympics paragraph here and moved it to the 1930s golden generation section (for the sake of lowering article size and deleting repetitive info)
Took out hyperbole on the introduction and also included the section on the blanquirroja (as to why the name). This was done as suggested by DeLarge.
/* Copa América record */ Removed the flags to make the article more consistent.
/* 1970s Golden generation */ Added accent to Calderon.
/* History */ Fixed ''la Blanquirroja'' and explained the nickname at before mentioning throughout the sections.
/* FIFA World Cup record */ Did as suggested by DeLarge.
/* Introduction of football */ Minor grammar fix.
/* Introduction of football */ Replaced findernetTV source for a more reliable source, gosouthamerica.about.com .
/* Notable players */ Added the Peruvian Football Federation, from CONMEBOL (the first source in the list of references), to better certify players in this section. Terra.com was previously used.
Moved around a couple of things to polish the article. I'm still awaiting for someone to begin the review GA process.
/* Football rivalries */ I think it's obvious that this is a football rivalry.
/* Notable players */ Added es icon to several sources, took out unsourced information.
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], typos fixed: oficially → officially, Commitee → Committee, spanish → Spanish (4) using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
Vandalism. Edgar Rojas is not a Peru football team player.
/* Current Youth Squad */ Will include it into the U-17 Squad page.
Reverted changes made to historic games. Please do not change these historical records to your liking.
/* 1930s Golden Generation */ Made it consistent with other mentions of formations.
/* Football rivalries */ Deadlink, and fixed section.
/* Qualifiers and participations */ Took out qualifier for 1970 WC. It's best to focus on the tournament itself, and only include the Qualifs of '86 and '98.
Following the guidelines of the Scotland national football team, no mention of notable players in the prelude to the article.
/* Recent and future matches */ Attempting to fix the article's size problem.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 272071294 by [[Special:Contributions/89.243.55.2|89.243.55.2]] ([[User talk:89.243.55.2|talk]]) Reverted sarcastically stupid vandalism.
Well, I found no source certifying the third kit.
/* Other tournaments */ Gold medals are already mentioned on the achievements section on the bottom.
/* Participation history */ Completely finished fixing all of the links. Hmmm...now the problem is the article's size.
/* Good Football, Few Titles */ Fixed links. Deleted an unreliable link and replaced it with a reliable one.
/* See also */ Included see also section into a template.
/* See also */ Removed wikilinks that are already mentioned in the article.
/* Memorable Games */ Fixed all references in this section into the appropiate format.
Robot-assisted fix [[WP:DPL|links to disambiguation page]] TBA
/* Memorable Games */ finished memorable games section.
/* Qualifiers and participations */ I think this section has already been truncated enough so that it only mentions records and leaves the story for the main article "Peru at the FIFA World Cup."
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 270748804 by [[Special:Contributions/Eduardocombe|Eduardocombe]] ([[User talk:Eduardocombe|talk]]) Addition of this content makes the article too long.
/* Kit evolution */ All of this content is completely unsourced. For the sake of the article, I will remove it until some good source is found to verify this information.
/* 1980s-1990s */ Done with the 80s and 90s. On to the sad present.
/* 1970s Golden Generation */ Done and done with the 1970s.
/* 1970s Golden Generation */ Improved section with more references. Not quite done yet, however.
/* Youth comers going to "Selecion Peruana" Summer 09 */ Future updates should be done on the article that links to this one. It will be for the best.
/* Youth comers going to "Selecion Peruana" Summer 09 */
No longer "long." As of now anyways...
/* Kit evolution */ difference in socks does not amount for a whole new kit.
Added {{[[Template:intro length|intro length]]}} tag to article. using [[WP:FRIENDLY|Friendly]]
/* Managers */ Added some more statistics. Almost done with the list.
/* Managers */ Updated sections of the Coaches. Peru's victory record keeps going down. haha.
/* Managers */ Did away with the good old chart of the managers. I'm sure many will miss the old chart, but the new one is way better.
/* Managers */ Added a new table with new interesting things.
/* Recent and future international matches */ Not all matches are international, as the game with Extremadura shows.
/* Managers */ Added reference for a series of managers.
